alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 9:39PM EDT until March 24 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion Henderson County in Western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. This is especially the case in parts of Hendersonville, and particularly along Mud and Bat Fork Creeks. In addition high flows are working there way down through the Green River and low lying areas there may flood as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 PM EDT, Flooding is expaning in coverage within the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Dupont State Forest, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana, Tuxedo, Crab Creek and Edneyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
